result.execSummary:
The defendant Sunny J McFarland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Must sign up for Probation by April 13, 2018.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages except for employment purposes.
Must have no contact with J.P.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge. Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail on a Tuesday/Wednesday/Friday, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, within the next 2 weeks to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: 2 days jail credit if Probation is revoked.

Must complete 40 hours of community service for each year on Probation.
4/10/2020 AMENDED: COURT REMOVES THE 40 HOURS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE CONDITION.

supervisions.notes: Court grants good time. Court will allow electronic monitoring is she may begin her programming sooner. Court grants 189 days credit.

01:43 PM Defendant Sunny J McFarland in court with attorney Emily Margaret Nelson.  Defendant Sunny J McFarland in custody.  John A Rafa Todd appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Revocation and letters reviewed by parties - no additions or corrections. 189 days credit stipulated to by the parties. 1:57 Minister from a facility provides statement - availability for the Defendant. 
2:02 Court in recess. 2:13 Court resumes. State changes recommendation from prison to the defendant's participation in the program available for her upon release. Defense makes recommendation. Defendant addresses the court. Court costs were previously reduced to civil judgment. 

Court relates and orders: 
10 months jail with good time and credit for 189 days. 
Court will allow electronic monitoring if she may begin her programming sooner.
